author: USA TODAY
title: Emmy Rossum's home burglarized, $150,000 worth of jewelry missing
text:

Join the Nation's Conversation To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs Emmy Rossum's home burglarized, $150,000 worth of jewelry missing Sara M Moniuszko , USA TODAY Published 10:43 a.m. ET March 29, 2017 | Updated 6 hours ago CLOSE x Share 'Shameless' actor Emmy Rossum took to Twitter to expose threatening tweets she received not long after the presidential election. Wochit Emmy Rossum x Share Actress Emmy Rossum is thanking Los Angeles police amid reports of a jewelry heist at her home. USA TODAY 
Shameless’s Emmy Rossum is the latest victim of a Hollywood Hills burglary. 
Officer Liliana Preciado told USA TODAY that $150,000 worth of jewelry and other items were taken from the actress's home sometime between Wednesday and Friday. The break-in, which occurred on the 9700 block of San Circle in Beverly Hills, was reported on Tuesday. 
Rossum took to Twitter on Tuesday morning to thank the Los Angeles Police Department for their support. Thank you to the LAPD. I fully support the police efforts and dedication. — Emmy Rossum (@emmyrossum) March 28, 2017 
The high-profile burglary marks one of several that have occurred in the Hollywood and greater Los Angeles area recently. The homes of other celebrities including Kendall Jenner , Nicki Minaj, Alanis Morissette and Lakers star Nick Young have also been hit. 
Preciado told USA TODAY that police are "not aware of any connection at this time." Read or Share this story: http://usat.ly/2oyiI2z
